{{convert|37|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship height= |Ship draft={{convert|13|ft|8|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship propulsion=*3 × boilers *2 × turbines, {{convert|5500|shp|abbr=on}} gun|{{convert|3|in|mm|abbr=on|0}}/50 AA guns]] *2 × twin [[Bofors 40 mm|40 mm guns]] *9 × single [[Oerlikon 20 mm cannon|20 mm]] *1 × [[Hedgehog (weapon)|Hedgehog]] [[anti-submarine mortar]] *8 × [[Depth charge projector|Y gun]] [[depth charge]] projectors *2 × depth charge racks |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''HMS ''Zanzibar'' (K596)''' was a {{sclass2-|Colony|frigate}} of the [[United Kingdom]] that served during [[World War II]]. She originally was ordered by the [[United States Navy]] as the [[Tacoma-class frigate|''Tacoma''-class patrol frigate]] '''USS ''Prowse'' (PF-92)''' and was transferred to the [[Royal Navy]] prior to completion.
==Construction and acquisition== The ship, originally designated a "patrol [[gunboat]]," '''PG-200''', was ordered by the [[United States Maritime Commission]] under a U.S. Navy contract as USS ''Prowse''. She was reclassified as a "[[patrol frigate]]," PF-92, on 15 April 1943 and [[Keel laying|laid down]] by the [[Walsh-Kaiser Company]] at [[Providence, Rhode Island|Providence]], [[Rhode Island]], on 20 October 1943. Intended for transfer to the United Kingdom, the ship was renamed ''Zanzibar'' by the British prior to [[Ship naming and launching|launching]] and was launched on 21 November 1943.
==Service history== Transferred to the United Kingdom under [[Lend-Lease]] on 21 June 1944, the ship served in the [[Royal Navy]] as HMS ''Zanzibar'' (K596). She operated out of [[Derry|Londonderry]], [[Northern Ireland]], and [[Greenock]], [[Scotland]], on [[convoy]] escort duty into the western [[Atlantic Ocean]] as far as [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]], [[Massachusetts]]. In addition, she served as a [[weather ship]] on [[Ocean weather station|Ocean Station]] No. 19 in both the spring of 1945 and the spring of 1946.
==Disposal== The United Kingdom returned ''Zanzibar'' to the U.S. Navy on 21 May 1946 at [[Brooklyn, New York|Brooklyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]], on 21 May 1946.<ref name="return"/> She was stricken from the U.S. [[Naval Vessel Register]] on 29 October 1946 and sold on 17 June 1947 for scrapping.
